name: Our Solar System
description: A guided journey through our neighborhood of space.
creator: Jan Foksinski

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.text:
Our journey of the solar system begins with our Sun. Did you know that the Sun is actually a star? The Sun also keeps all of the planets in order using a force called gravity.
Do you want to:

b50d423b-bfbc-4641-84ba-c0f7eee9b54e.text:
Gravity is a force that acts on all things that have mass. Me, you, a house; all have mass! Gravity is the reason why, when you jump, you come back down. Without gravity, you would just float off into space if you jumped!
Do you want to:

283fc8eb-3297-4215-a174-021597207484.text:
Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, and it’s also the fastest! In fact, one year on Mercury is only 88 Earth days! The planet zips around the Sun at about 29 miles per second, that’s 104400 miles per hour! Days on Mercury take a long time to complete. In fact, it takes about 59 Earth days for one day to pass on Mercury!
Do you want to:

options.text: Learn about things that go fast

fae3029c-cf1c-46d7-9f18-a111eefa5175.text:
There are many fast things around us. One of the fastest animals in the world is the Cheetah, which can run up to 80 miles per hour! One of the fastest cars that you can buy can hit speeds of over 300 miles per hour! All of these things are slow in comparison to the fastest man made object: The Helios Satellite. The Helios satellite was created to study the Sun by getting closer to it than Mercury is to the Sun. The satellite is also the fastest man-made object that got up to 157,100 miles per hour!
Do you want to:

080dd8bf-df98-4f9c-9ca0-7597c859fc56.text: Venus is not the last planet in the solar system, but it's where this journey ends. Have fun!
